title: Are drones used in forestry today? - Quora

response.answer_text: Hi Drones are nowadays being used in many fields and forestry is one of them. With an increase in interest to the use of technology, especially in the collection of high revolutionized data, drone technology can help in accumulating accurate data. Forest drones are helpful in collecting a large amount of data within minutes. Comprehending the exact number of trees at various locations, it ensures steady growth and maximization of profits.  Here are the different applications where people are taking help of drone technology in Forestry: Mapping of ForestsSustainable Forest Planning and ManagementTree Planting At Remote LocationsForest MonitoringMapping of Canopy GapsRescue OperationsThere are some of the applications on which drones have been proved very useful. Here are some of the benefits that forest drones offer: PROVIDE ACCURATE TREE COUNTSMap harvest units and conduct post-harvest waste assessmentsPLAN ACCESS ROADS AND INFRASTRUCTURERemove trees with software for bare earth terrain models3D SCAN OF FORESTSVR walkthrough and inventory managementThese points prove that drone technology is really helpful in forest industry that’s why the people in forest industry have started using it and in near future, it will become a crucial part in forestry. Many drone companies such as Candrone have are selling a wide range of forest drones, LiDARs and softwares too. You can check out that on their website. Thanks!!

Yes they are. In fact we are currently using a small DJI Mavic Pro 2 for surveying in our forests. (And thinking about getting a drone with a nIR-Camera as that would make surveying for diseased trees even more effective) Having a small and easily/cheaply deplorable surveying tool is awesome and very time saving.

Yes.Seven actual or possible missions come to mind immediately: planting trees in remote locations,surveying for mapping,surveillance for diseased/parched areas of treesdelivery of supplies, etcspraying in area with precisionsearch and rescue of persons or animalstracking paths through forests.
Yes. My college colleague currently working on remote sensing/survey company. They use drone to map/survey areas such as palm oil plantation.
